title: Is it useful to learn to write with your left hand? - Quora

response.answer_text: As a left handed oddity in a predominantly right handed world, I think it would be a waste of effort to learn how to write using both hands unless your right hand is at a constant risk of getting damaged permanently (work related, etc.) Lets put things into perspective;  1. Most things are more ergonomically designed for right handed people.  2. You'd always be a bit better using your dominant hand when writing even with much practice. 3. Should knock on wood (hope it doesn't happen), something happens and the need to using the non-dominant hand come, you'd probably learn much faster because its a "need" not a "want". I'd suggest spending the time and effort to learn something more viable and useful say a new language or skill.

yep...learning something new is always useful in some or other way..learning can never be a waste..and yes it is definitely helpful in improving some skills.. like ACTIVATION OF BRAIN..doing something new always activates your brain and make it work better and better.. so keep trying new things..and yeah dont mind your writing when you will write with left hand.. :-P
